column5: i'm sure you could make some money off an idea like that.
Throw a camo tarp over that and you've got a blind (ice fishing hut, tent, whatever). Nice use of transferable skills. Jim
thats awsome!  your going to have a blast working the back lakes now!  Cheers!
that's awesome now if we can get and aerial shot of that in the bush lol

as a kid fishing many back lakes camping etc ,most of your know the experiance I miss it terribly ,and am not ready to start hauling gear on my back like the good ole days to get into these same lakes ,Yesterday I got busy and built a boat carrier and outboard rack on the old yard/plow bike,its gonna be nice to hit them largemouth lakes again

Thats awesome, its amazing the possibilities a welder opens up aint it.  We have welders at work and i find myself staying late alot to make all kinds of fun stuff that would otherwise cost me a fortune.  Take them corners Sloooooooow though lol
Great set up . should make for some fun trips  TB
excellent set up, i have one myself (store bought though) and love it, don't take it up gravel pits though LOL

That is just amazeing got my mind working . I have  racks I can mount on mine for carrying in my hunting stuff (rifles ,bows and packs etc.) in the fall and a rack I can put on for ice fishing with mounts for augers and gear , never thought of something like this , great idea Hope Im not stealing your patent , lol  but I got to make one of these
haha nope build away ,thanks fellas ,im really gonna enjoy it ,now if ya copy the custom front winch bumper im building  for my Honda Foreman will have to discuss lawyers jk haha
Good project and great results  Now you don't have any excuses for not targetting those back lakes Good job North East Shark and thanks for sharing Leechman

Looks like a great rack you built there....I've been thinking about building one myself but I'm a little sceptical on the stability ofthe ATV when going over rough terrain...It sure looks top heavy....have you taking this into consideration??
yeah I strapped it down this morning and went for a test,im a big boy and maybe that helps but had no problem with any off camber climbing
Nice, now all you need is a ramp system to be able to load it yourself (using that front mounted winch you hinted at)  Just add a windshield and a tarp and you have a portable hut for the winter
Awesome job. Was thinking of something like that for my Big Bear as well.

a lot of trails I went on , that would be way too high for the branches on the trees and it might be way to top heavy for many of the hills I went up and down  but it`s great if it will work on the trails you ride
time will tell Terry may be in for some hairy rides
That's Cool!!!!  I guess ya just gotta flip it upside down and put the out board on it and you're good to go..     Great Job!  RFS

i was thinking of making one of those to, what did you use to bolt it to the racks? is it a easy put on and take off the 4wheeler, im sure you dont want that on there all the time if you wanted to go for a quad ride with the buds.

I havent permanently secured it yet gotta paint it first ,going either U bolt it or bolt thru,as far as taking it off to go riding theres 2 new bikes in the garage for that ,this is just a yard/plow now backlake bike
Me ,You and Dave all on that .Your dad and Dave's gear on a second one,and away we go!
are we describing Pamela Anderson? If we are, I agree.

Hey we know a great Largemouth Lake, it was always loaded and fun way back not sure if anyones fished it much since ,theres nothing else in there but Bass,also theres a ole trappers cabin we can stay in for the weekend,then a weekend in Miners
Sounds great.I wont tell Dave about the cabin,no-one will ever hear from him again.
Love the Rack and the Idea.  Built something out of wood for my pickup.  What I added is a Piece of PVC on the back ramp to act as a roller as I found it easier to roll on then off.
Holdfast thats a great idea I was thinking of slicing up some water pipe last night for the top sections to keep the drag of metal on metal down

Nice Rig dude...I love modifying my toys to.  And by the looks of  things sombeody loves Johnson Motors! lol I see a little 2hp honda in the mix there to! do you have a boat for each motor?!?  cheers, UF
no those are to far gone to fix cost wise, besides the 90 its been rebuilt a few seasons back,the rest are parts motors
Hold fast great idea for the "Roller" simple but it works.  " If ya cant be handsome be handy" Red Fisher
